intro: Labramia ambondrombeensis, commonly known as the Madagascar bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of eastern Madagascar. It has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
